flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: Simple attatchment of two more coat hangers, to catch larger wavelengths
guide.introduction_rendered: Simple attatchment of two more coat hangers, to catch larger wavelengths

lines.text: I'll start backwards, I added approximately five feet of wire, at the contacts for the transformer. Suspended by fishing line tied at the ends, resting on top screws of antenna
lines.text_raw: I'll start backwards, I added approximately five feet of wire, at the contacts for the transformer. Suspended by fishing line tied at the ends, resting on top screws of antenna

lines.text: Is this the proper size for VHF channels?, probably not.  But, I do receive PBS in Sacramento from twenty miles away, so GOOD ENOUGH.  Each vhf arm is one coat hanger.
lines.text_raw: Is this the proper size for VHF channels?, probably not.  But, I do receive PBS in Sacramento from twenty miles away, so GOOD ENOUGH.  Each vhf arm is one coat hanger.

guide.summary: The new DTV signals aren't all UHF, so attatch some more coat hangers to your MAKE gray-hoverman antenna
guide.title: DTV Antenna VHF Mod
